column4: Nokia delays phablet launch after Microsoft deal -source
column5: Sept 16 Nokia has delayed the launch of a large-screen "phablet" device  originally planned for late September  following a deal to sell its handset business and license patents to Microsoft  a source said on Monday.

column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Sept 16 Chipmaker Nvidia  said on Monday it had appointed a former Cisco and Microsoft executive as its new chief financial officer  ending a search of more than two years after its previous CFO left.

column5: Pluristem Therapeutics Inc said the U.S. Food and Drug Administration lifted its clinical hold on a mid-stage trial of the company's experimental drug for muscle pain.

column4: UPDATE 1-Stansted to cut Ryanair fees in return for more flights
column5: LONDON  Sept 16 Ryanair has persuaded London's Stansted airport to cut the fees levied on the low-cost airline in return for a promise of sharply increased flights to and from the airport in coming years.

column4: Tencent invests $448 mln to buy 36.5 pct stake in Sohu's search engine
column5: BEIJING  Sept 16 Tencent Holdings Ltd  said on Monday that it will buy a  36.5 percent stake in Sohu.com Inc's Sogou search engine  China's third-largest  to lift its presence in the  fast-growing China market for search and Internet services.

column4: Vodafone has 76.48 percent of Kabel Deutschland shares
column5: FRANKFURT Vodafone  has secured 76.48 percent of shares in Kabel Deutschland  for its 7.7 billion euro ($10 billion) offer for Germany's largest cable company  the telecom operator said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Vodafone has 76.48 pct of Kabel Deutschland shares
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 16 Vodafone has secured 76.48 percent of shares in Kabel Deutschland for its 7.7 billion euro ($10 billion)offer for Germany's largest cable company  the telecom operator said on Monday.

column4: Vodafone says has 76.48 pct of Kabel shares for $10 bln offer
RPT-Vodafone says has 76.48 pct of Kabel shares for $10 bln offer
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 16 Vodafone has secured 76.48 percent of shares in Kabel Deutschland for its 7.7 billion euro ($10 billion)offer for Germany's largest cable company  Vodafone said on Monday.

column4: Vodafone says has 76.48 pct of Kabel shares for $10 bln offer
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 16 Vodafone has secured 76.48 percent of shares in Kabel Deutschland for its 7.7 billion euro ($10 billion)offer for Germany's largest cable company  Vodafone said on Monday.

column4: Australia's new PM Abbott unveils cabinet  to be sworn in Wednesday
column5: CANBERRA  Sept 16 Australia's new conservative Prime Minister Tony Abbott unveiled his first cabinet on Monday  using the appointment of experienced lawmakers to promise a stable government after three years of minority rule.

column4: Kennametal boosts tungsten supply with Allegheny Tech's unit buy
column5: Kennametal Inc  said it would buy Allegheny Technologies Inc's  tungsten materials business for $605 million to boost supply of the raw material used to make its metal-working tools  increasing its exposure to aerospace and energy markets.

column4: Kennametal to buy Allegheny's tungsten materials business for $605 mln
column5: Sept 16 Industrial toolmaker Kennametal Inc  said it would buy Allegheny Technologies Inc's  tungsten materials business for $605 million to strengthen its materials and cutting tools business.

column4: Stress test shows Bank of America adequately capitalized
column5: Sept 16 Bank of America Corp said its mid-cycle stress test showed that the bank had enough capital to withstand a severe economic downturn.

column4: RPT-U.S. banks to get 3rd-qtr profit boost from dipping into reserves
column5: * JPMorgan  Bank of America  Wells Fargo expected to release reserves

column4: U.S. Air Force vows to shield 3 weapons programs from budget cuts
column5: NATIONAL HARBOR  Maryland  Sept 16 The top U.S. Air Force official on Monday vowed to protect three weapons programs from sweeping federal budget cuts: Lockheed Martin Corp's F-35 fighter jet  a new refueling plane built by Boeing Co and early work on a new bomber.

column4: UPDATE 5-Bombardier's all-new CSeries makes inaugural flight
column5: MIRABEL  Quebec  Sept 16 Bombardier Inc's  CSeries jetliner successfully completed its first flight on Monday  a key step in a $3.4 billion program to develop the first all-new narrow-body plane of its size in decades that the company hopes will increase sales.

column4: Factbox - Key facts about Bombardier's CSeries jet
column5: Sept 16 Reuters) - Following are some facts about Bombardier Inc's  CSeries passenger jet  a narrowbody rival to Airbus and Boeing aircraft  which was scheduled to carry out its much anticipated maiden flight on Monday.

column4: Bombardier's all-new CSeries prepares for maiden flight
column5: MIRABEL  Quebec  Sept 16 Bombardier Inc  carried out final preparations for the maiden flight of its CSeries on Monday  hoping to translate its ambitions to shatter an Airbus and Boeing duopoly into faster sales of Canada's most ambitious jet.

column4: Norwegian Air suffers another Dreamliner technical fault
column5: OSLO  Sept 16 Norwegian Air Shuttle has suffered another technical fault with one of its Boeing  787 Dreamliners  the latest in a series of glitches to hit the new carbon-fibre jet.

column4: Boeing moves closer to South Korean fighter jet deal
column5: SEOUL Top decision makers in South Korea's 8.3 trillion won ($7.64 billion) fighter jet tender have briefed the president on the outcome of an assessment process and told her that Boeing Co's F-15 Silent Eagle was the sole eligible bid  a source with knowledge of the process told Reuters.

column4: Boeing moves closer to South Korean fighter jet deal
column5: SEOUL  Sept 16 Top decision makers in South Korea's 8.3 trillion won ($7.64 billion) fighter jet tender have briefed the president on the outcome of an assessment process and told her that Boeing Co's F-15 Silent Eagle was the sole eligible bid  a source with knowledge of the process told Reuters.

column4: TD Bank  CIBC reach deal on Aeroplan Visa card
column5: Toronto-Dominion Bank  agreed on Monday to buy about half of Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce's  Aeroplan Visa  credit card portfolio in a deal that will see both banks issue the popular and lucrative rewards card.

column4: CORRECTED-TD to issue Aeroplan credit cards  CIBC to keep half of portfolio
column5: (Corrects paragraph 2 to say earnings of 10 Canadian cents per share is on an adjusted basis)

column4: TABLE-Delinquency rates fall at major U.S. banks in August
column5: Sept 16 Delinquency rates fell at most major U.S. banks for August as more consumers continued to keep up with their bill payments. Delinquency rates  however  rose for Capital One Financial and Discover Financial. Credit card charge-offs have fallen  except for JPMorgan Chase  Bank of America and Capital One Financial.

column4: CF Industries picks new CEO with expansion under way
column5: Sept 16 The longtime chief executive of CF Industries Holdings Inc will retire and be replaced internally  just as it carries out a $3.8-billion expansion  the world's second-biggest producer of nitrogen fertilizer said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-China's Sinopec to resume large diesel exports with Q4 quota
column5: * Sinopec gets Q4 diesel export quota of more than 1 mln T -sources

column4: Fitch Upgrades CNA's Ratings; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  September 16 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has upgraded CNA Financial  Corporation's (CNA) Issuer Default Rating (IDR) to 'BBB+' from 'BBB' and its  senior unsecured debt to 'BBB' from 'BBB-'. Also  Fitch has upgraded the Insurer  Financial Strength (IFS) ratings of CNA's property/casualty insurance  subsidiaries to 'A' from 'A-'. The Rating Outlook for all ratings is Stable. A  full rating list is shown below. KEY RATING DRIVERS Fitch

column4: Arbitrator delays sale of two Cooper Tire plants to India's Apollo
column5: Sept 16 A U.S arbitrator said Cooper Tire and Rubber Co cannot sell two of its factories in the country to India's Apollo Tyres until a collective bargaining agreement is reached between Apollo and members of the plants' union.

column4: Encana shuts 397 gas wells in Colorado due to flooding
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Sept 16 Canadian natural gas producer Encana Corp has shut 397 out of 1 241 wells in the Denver-Julesburg basin  Colorado  as a result of recent flooding in the state  a company spokesman said on Monday.

column4: Manufacturing sector regaining some momentum
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. factory output surged in August as the pace of motor vehicle assemblies jumped to a six-year high  a hopeful sign for the economy after a slow start to the third quarter.

column4: PRESS DIGEST-Canada-Sept 16
column5: Sept 16 The following are the top stories from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

column4: Ford to install electric vehicle charging stations for employees
column5: DETROIT Ford Motor Co  said on Monday it will install charging stations at more than 50 of its U.S. and Canadian offices and plants so that employees can refill their electric vehicle batteries at work.

column4: Ford to install electric vehicle charging stations for employees
column5: DETROIT  Sept 16 Ford Motor Co said on Monday it will install charging stations at more than 50 of its U.S. and Canadian offices and plants so that employees can refill their electric vehicle batteries at work.

column4: UPDATE 1-GSK cancer drug combination wins US priority review
column5: LONDON  Sept 16 A combination treatment from GlaxoSmithkline for melanoma  the deadliest form of skin cancer  has won priority review from U.S. regulators.

column4: GSK cancer drug combination gets U.S. priority review
column5: LONDON  Sept 16 A combination treatment from GlaxoSmithkline for melanoma  the deadliest form of skin cancer  has won priority review from U.S. regulators.

column4: MOVES- Goldman Sachs  Danske Bank  Credit Suisse  Gain Capital
column5: Sept 16 The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Monday. To inform us of other job changes  email to moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column4: Starboard calls Emulex "extremely undervalued"  seeks new board
column5: Sept 16 Activist hedge fund Starboard Value LP said network equipment maker Emulex Corp was "extremely undervalued" and called for reconstituting the board to include shareholder advocates.

column4: Exclusive: Goldman names Chavez as CIO  when Scopellite retires
column5: NEW YORK Goldman Sachs Group Inc  has named R. Martin Chavez to become chief information officer when Steven Scopellite  a 28-year veteran of the bank's technology group  retires at year-end  according to internal memos on Monday.

column4: Analysis: Texas sale gives breathing room to Floyd Wilson's Halcón
column5: NEW YORK Floyd Wilson made a $303 million Texas land deal last week that buys time and provides cash for the chief executive of Halcón Resources Corp  to do what he does best: spruce up an oil company and sell it off to the highest bidder.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: (Adds Rockwood Holdings  Harsco Corp  Glencore Xstrata  Prudential  Trainose. Updates Packaging Corp  Kennametal)

column4: UPDATE 1-Harsco boosts balance sheet through infrastructure unit deal
column5: * To get 29 pct stake in company to be formed through deal

column4: Harsco to sell infrastructure business to Clayton  Dubilier & Rice
column5: Sept 16 Engineering company Harsco Corp  said it would sell its infrastructure business for $300 million to private equity firm Clayton  Dubilier & Rice.

column4: Rockwood close to selling pigments units to Huntsman -sources
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 16 Rockwood Holdings Inc  is in advanced talks to sell its titanium dioxide business and other pigments units to Huntsman Corp.  three people with knowledge of the matter from the banking and chemicals industry told Reuters on Monday.

column4: U.S. banks say they are safer by their own measures
column5: NEW YORK The biggest U.S. banks  including JPMorgan Chase & Co  and Bank of America Corp   said that by their own reckoning they are better equipped to withstand a shock to global markets and economies now than they were in March.

column4: U.S. indicts two ex-traders in JPMorgan 'London Whale' scandal
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 16 A U.S. grand jury has indicted two former JPMorgan Chase & Co traders at the center of the bank's "London Whale" scandal  court papers made public on Monday show.

column4: JPMorgan adequately capitalized in mid-cycle stress test
column5: JPMorgan Chase & Co's  capital ratios would be above the minimum regulatory requirements in case of a hypothetical "severely adverse scenario " according to mid-cycle stress test results released on Monday.

column4: JPMorgan adequately capitalized in mid-cycle stress test
column5: Sept 16 JPMorgan Chase & Co's capital ratios would be above the minimum regulatory requirements in case of a hypothetical "severely adverse scenario " according to mid-cycle stress test results released on Monday.

column4: JPMorgan expects to settle Whale probes for about $700 million: source
column5: JPMorgan Chase & Co  is close to settling investigations into its London Whale derivatives loss and expects to pay about $700 million  according to a source familiar with the matter.

column4: UPDATE 1-JPMorgan expects to settle Whale probes for about $700 mln -source
column5: Sept 16 JPMorgan Chase & Co is close to settling investigations  into its London Whale derivatives loss and expects to pay about $700 million  according to a source familiar with the matter.

column4: JPMorgan near deal on Whale probes for about $700 mln-source
column5: Sept 16 JPMorgan Chase & Co is near a final settlement of probes into its London Whale derivatives loss and expects to pay about $700 million  according to source familiar with the matter.

column5: * JPMorgan  Bank of America  Wells Fargo expected to release reserves

column4: Kennametal boosts tungsten supply with Allegheny Tech's unit buy
column5: Kennametal Inc  said it would buy Allegheny Technologies Inc's  tungsten materials business for $605 million to boost supply of the raw material used to make its metal-working tools  increasing its exposure to aerospace and energy markets.

column4: Kennametal to buy Allegheny's tungsten materials business for $605 mln
column5: Sept 16 Industrial toolmaker Kennametal Inc  said it would buy Allegheny Technologies Inc's  tungsten materials business for $605 million to strengthen its materials and cutting tools business.

column4: KKR's Henry Kravis sees rising opportunities in Japan
column5: HONG KONG  Sept 16 Henry Kravis  co-founder of private-equity firm KKR & Co LP  said he sees rising opportunities for dealmaking in Japan as the country's corporations become more open to foreign partnerships.

column4: S.Korea's KT bids for Tunisie Telecom
column5: SEOUL  Sept 17 South Korean telecoms operator KT Corp said on Tuesday it is in the early stage of talks to buy a 35-percent stake in state-owned Tunisie Telecom from a conglomerate owned by Dubai's ruler  joining about 10 other bidders.

column4: UK kicks off Lloyds bank share sale
column5: LONDON Britain will sell a 6 percent stake in part-nationalized Lloyds Banking Group  at a price of at least 75 pence per share  raising over 3.2 billion pounds ($5.1 billion)  three sources familiar with the transaction said.

column4: UPDATE 4-UK kicks off Lloyds bank share sale
column5: LONDON  Sept 16 Britain will sell a 6 percent stake in part-nationalised Lloyds Banking Group at a price of at least 75 pence per share  raising over 3.2 billion pounds ($5.1 billion)  three sources familiar with the transaction said.

column4: Lloyds share placing priced at 75-76 pence/share
column5: LONDON  Sept 16 Britain will price a sale of shares in Lloyds Banking Group at between 75 pence and 76 pence per share  a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.

column4: UK to sell 6 pct stake in Lloyds Banking Group
column5: LONDON  Sept 16 Britain will sell about 6 percent of part-nationalised Lloyds Banking Group  worth about 3.3 billion pounds  via a placing to institutional investors  UK Financial Investments (UKFI) said on Monday.

column4: Credit Suisse banker tasked with UK sale of Lloyds  RBS stakes
column5: LONDON The organization that holds Britain's stakes in banks has picked senior Credit Suisse banker James Leigh Pemberton as its new boss  handing him the task of selling the taxpayers' stakes in Lloyds  and Royal Bank of Scotland .

column4: UPDATE 1-Credit Suisse banker tasked with UK sale of Lloyds  RBS stakes
column5: LONDON  Sept 16 The organisation that holds Britain's stakes in banks has picked senior Credit Suisse banker James Leigh Pemberton as its new boss  handing him the task of selling the taxpayers' stakes in Lloyds and Royal Bank of Scotland.

column4: Pentagon holding less progress payment back on Lockheed F-35 contract
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 16 The Pentagon said on Monday that it has reduced its withholding of progress payments on Lockheed Martin Corp's F-35 fighter jet program to 2 percent from 5 percent after the company got a passing grade on 15 of 16 tasks required to fix a deficient internal business system.

column4: U.S. Air Force vows to shield 3 weapons programs from budget cuts
column5: NATIONAL HARBOR  Maryland  Sept 16 The top U.S. Air Force official on Monday vowed to protect three weapons programs from sweeping federal budget cuts: Lockheed Martin Corp's F-35 fighter jet  a new refueling plane built by Boeing Co and early work on a new bomber.

column4: Lockheed Martin wins rare commercial contract for Atlas launch
column5: CAPE CANAVERAL  Florida Lockheed Martin Corp  has won a rare commercial contract for launch services on its unmanned Atlas 5 rocket  officials said on Thursday.

column4: CORRECTED-Lockheed Martin wins rare commercial contract for Atlas launch
column5: CAPE CANAVERAL  Fla.  Sept 12 Lockheed Martin Corp has won a rare commercial contract for launch services on its unmanned Atlas 5 rocket  officials said on Thursday.

column4: ON THE MOVE-HighTower adds adviser team from Morgan Stanley
column5: Sept 16 HighTower Advisors LLC  an independent adviser-owned firm that has grown by hiring away from top U.S. brokerages  said on Monday it hired a veteran team of advisers from Morgan Stanley Wealth Management to expand the firm's presence in Alabama.

column4: Northrop sees foreign sales opportunities for Global Hawk
column5: NATIONAL HARBOR  Maryland Northrop Grumman Corp  on Monday said it expects expanded sales of its high-altitude unmanned Global Hawk aircraft  which passed 100 000 flight hours this month  with foreign countries including Canada  South Korea and Japan considering orders.

column4: Orange Spain lodges complaint over Telefonica-Yoigo deal
column5: MADRID  Sept 16 French telecoms firm Orange's  Spanish unit has lodged a complaint with the country's competition regulator over a tie-up between rivals Telefonica  and TeliaSonera's Yoigo  the company said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Packaging Corp wraps up $1.28 bln deal for Boise
Packaging Corp offers to buy Boise for $1.28 billion
column5: Packaging Corp of America said it would acquire smaller rival Boise Inc for about $1.28 billion to boost its container board capacity.

column4: Pandora warns growth is slowing  proposes follow-on offering
column5: Pandora Media Inc warned on Monday that its business is slowing and proposed a follow-on offering of 10 million shares for capital expenditures  according to a regulatory filing.

column4: Pandora warns growth is slowing  proposes follow-on offering
column5: Sept 16 Pandora Media Inc warned on Monday that its business is slowing and proposed a follow-on offering of 10 million shares for capital expenditures  according to a regulatory filing.

column4: Major PetroChina supplier Wison in spotlight  shares still suspended
column5: HONG KONG/BEIJING  Sept 17 A corruption investigation into PetroChina has put the spotlight on Chinese entrepreneur Hua Bangsong and the links that his company  Wison Engineering Services  has with the oil giant.

column4: UPDATE 1-China's Sinopec to resume large diesel exports with Q4 quota
column5: * Sinopec gets Q4 diesel export quota of more than 1 mln T -sources

column4: Brazil likely to hike fuel prices by Oct. 21 -report
column5: SAO PAULO  Sept 16 Brazil's government may allow state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA to raise fuel prices by Oct. 21  the date of the first auction of exploration rights for the Libra subsalt oil field  newspaper O Estado de S. Paulo said on Monday.

column4: PNC releases mid-year stress test results
column5: Sept 16 PNC Financial Services Group Inc's  projected Tier 1 common ratio will fall to a low of 9.4 percent through the second quarter of 2015 under a severely adverse scenario  the lender's mid-year stress test results showed.

column4: Fitch Comments on Sherwin-Williams' Acquisition of U.S./Canada Business of Comex
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  September 16 (Fitch) The Sherwin-Williams Company (NYSE: SHW) announced  today that it has completed the acquisition of the U.S./Canada business of  Consorcio Comex  S.A. de C.V. (Comex).  SHW will pay $90 million in cash and  assume liabilities currently valued in the range of $75 million.   In November 2012  SHW announced the proposed acquisition of Comex for $2.34  billion.  Comex is a privately held business with operations

column4: Analysis: Japan faces record-long trade deficit  little sign can reverse trend
column5: TOKYO Japan is on course for its longest run of trade deficits  effectively marking the end of the nation's decades-long reliance on exports from the likes of electronics giant Sony and automaker Toyota as a driver of growth and income.

column4: Telecom Italia chairman confirms board to meet on Oct. 3
column5: TURIN  Sept 16 Telecom Italia chairman Franco Bernabe confirmed on Monday that a board meeting expected for September 19 would take place on October 3.

column4: Telecom Italia delays strategic board meeting: sources
column5: MILAN Telecom Italia has scrapped a crucial board meeting due later this week  people with knowledge of the situation said  as it buys time to figure out a new shareholder structure that could revive its fortunes after years of underperformance.

column4: Telecom Italia scraps Sept. 19 board meeting-sources
column5: MILAN  Sept 16 Telecom Italia has scrapped a crucial board meeting due to take place on Sept. 19 as it needs more time to figure out a new shareholder structure  two sources with knowledge of the situation told Reuters.

column4: Telecom IT board expected to meet again on Oct 3-sources
column5: MILAN  Sept 16 Board members at Telecom Italia  are expected to reconvene on Oct. 3  two sources said on Monday  following a crucial meeting this week to assess strategic options including a possible new partner for the Italian telecoms incumbent.

column4: FDA approves Teva's generic version of Roche cancer drug Xeloda
column5: Sept 16 The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said it approved Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd's  generic version of Roche Holding AG's cancer drug Xeloda.

column4: FEATURE-All that glitters: Diamonds outshine gold for Chinese brides
column5: SHANGHAI  Sept 17 Under a black-and-white framed photo of the New York skyline  a bottle of Moet & Chandon champagne cools in the private bridal salon at Tiffany & Co's  flagship Shanghai store  while white roses and love poems set the mood for China's Romeo to pop the question to his Juliet.

column4: Pratt sees 2.5 pct or more cost cut on next F-35 engines
column5: NATIONAL HARBOR  Maryland Pratt & Whitney  a unit of United Technologies Corp   on Monday said it expects to drive down the cost of the F135 engines it builds for the U.S. F-35 fighter jet at least 2.5 percent  and perhaps more  in its next two production contracts.

column5: NATIONAL HARBOR  Maryland Pratt & Whitney  a unit of United Technologies Corp   on Monday said it expects to drive down the cost of the F135 engines it builds for the U.S. F-35 fighter jet at least 2.5 percent  and perhaps more  in its next two production contracts.

column4: TD Bank  CIBC reach deal on Aeroplan Visa card
column5: Toronto-Dominion Bank  agreed on Monday to buy about half of Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce's  Aeroplan Visa  credit card portfolio in a deal that will see both banks issue the popular and lucrative rewards card.

column5: Sept 16 Wells Fargo & Co is sufficiently capitalized to weather a hypothetical 'severely adverse scenario'  the bank's mid-cycle stress test results showed.
